DOC.brief_summary: During non urgent surgery , general anesthesia might induce enterocyte damage . I-FABP performant biomarker enterocyte damage . We aim study whether patient ongoing general anesthesia non-urgent surgery elevation plasma I-FABP concentration .
DOC.detailed_description: Inclusion criterion - Indication non-urgent surgery - General anesthesia protocol use propofol remifentanyl - One half patient history ischemic arteriopathy - One half patient history ischemic arteriopathy Exclusion criterion - Age < 18 year old - Pregnant Primary objective Is significant elevation I-FABP pre-anesthesic period 11 minute induction general anesthesia ? Secondary objective 1 . Is I-FABP elevation high among patient history patent arteriopathy ? 2 . Is I-FABP elevation high among patient present hypotension anesthesia ?
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion Indication nonurgent surgery General anesthesia protocol use propofol remifentanyl One half patient history ischemic arteriopathy One half patient history ischemic arteriopathy Exclusion criterion Age < 18 year old Pregnant
